intro: Cryptocentrum peruvianum subsp. dactylinum, commonly known as the Peruvian cryptocentrum, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and orange. The plant features succulent leaves that are often thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native arid environment. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant.
